Description: Body fragment of North Ionian Middle Wild Goat II pottery bowl; interior: glazed red with two bands of added purple lined in white; exterior, cream slip: part of a wild goat to left on groundline formed by thick horizontal band with added purple stripe lined in white; filling ornaments: rosette, cross-pattern, roundel; zone of solid tongues with double outline below the main decorated field.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.093)
Jones 1986 / Greek and Cypriot Pottery: a Review of Scientific Studies (p.701, table 8.18, no.7; p.663, pl.8.13)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (II D pl. IV 12)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
